page.title: 15Mrs Teggin & Osborne House
page.content: Mrs. Y. Teggin loves Little Heath. She came from Knightsbridge, London, and has three children. Her main hopes are for peace and better discipline in society. The house was built in 1701 and has Georgian sash windows, panelled doors, an Adam fireplace, a Welsh dresser and bells which used to call the servants. Mr. and Mrs. Teggin have lived here for 36 years and they built a high brick wall around the garden. There is a Victoria post box in the wall. They have always had dogs, first spaniels then labradors. The Duke of Leeds and an M.P. for Hertford have lived here.
